intro: Clidemia intermedia, commonly known as the stinging nettle plant, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial shrub native to tropical regions of the Americas. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with serrated edges and produces small, clustered white flowers. It is characterized by its stinging hairs on the leaves and stems, which can cause irritation upon contact. Clidemia intermedia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
